page.title: 12BREDON SPRINGS, ASHTON
page.content: This consists of two eighteenth century stone cottages with some red brick, ninteenth century additions. They were made into one residence by the present owner in 1955 with little alteration to the original structure. Today{Bredon Springs}is chiefly notable for it's garden which has been open to the public since 1969. It has a large collection of hardy plants in informally planted areas between and among trees and shrubs. The aim has been to create natural plant groupings and indeed, many plants are self sown seedlings left where they have fallen. As important as the plants, is the wildlife. Twentysix species of birds have nested there in recent years. Moles, rabbits and field mice are tolerated and no insecticides are used An old style cottage garden has been created using modern ideas on ecology.
